question: The TCP header specifies which value to ensure that data is processed by the correct application?
Which TCP flag is used to gracefully terminate a session between two systems?
Which statement correctly characterizes the functions of the OSI Model? It is a...
answer: method of describing the functions of a networking system to allow communication

question: Which common services occur at the presentation layer of the OSI Model?
The physical address applied by the data link layer of the OSI Model has which features?
answer: It is expressed using a 12-character hexadecimal value and it is unique to every network interface

question: Which device or service would not operate at the physical layer of the OSI Model?
Which type of communication would be analogous to a half duplex transmission?
A fixed payload typically has which benefits or characteristics?
answer: they can be more efficient than variable payloads and they are always the same size

question: If you needed to be certain that your data transmissions are being received, which type of connection and protocol should be used?
Which command can be used to determine the MTU optimal size?
Which protocols operate at the application layer of the OSI Model?
Which type of traffic management service occurs at the network layer of the OSI Model?
Which device or service would not operate at the physical layer of the OSI Model?
The physical address applied by the data link layer of the OSI Model has which features?
Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for node-to-node data delivery and framing?
Which device or service operates at the data link layer to manage node-to-node communication?
What is the purpose of the Logical Link Control (LLC) sub-layer in the Data Link Layer?
What is a key distinction of the components at the physical layer of the OSI model?
Which of the following is NOT a responsibility of the Data Link Layer?
In the OSI model, which layer is responsible for transforming data from bits into electrical signals for transmission?
What is the primary purpose of the Media Access Control (MAC) sub-layer in the Data Link Layer?
answer: Handles physical addressing, specifically using the MAC address of devices, and helps establish direct node-to-node communication on the same network.

question: Why is the layered approach of the OSI model beneficial for network communication?
answer: allows for effective communication by organizing network functions; ensures vendors focus on the entire network protocol stack; divides data communication into seven layers, each with a specific job, making it easier to isolate and troubleshoot issues
